definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: And he uses it to help people around the village.
sentences.chinese: 並且，他利用這支神筆來幫助村莊裏的窮人。

sentences.english: Ma Liang went back to draw for the poor again.
sentences.chinese: 從此以後，馬良繼續用他的神筆幫窮人們畫畫。

sentences.english: Ma Liang the Magic Brush is one of my favourite tales.
sentences.chinese: 《神筆馬良》是我最喜歡的童話之一。

sentences.english: And arts with thy sweet graces graced be;
sentences.chinese: 用你的神筆做些藝術的精減。

sentences.english: The bad man didn't have gold. So he painted gold with the magic paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 有個不幫助別人的壞人，他把馬良的神筆拿走了。

sentences.english: The magic paintbrush didn't make gold. It made a snake.
sentences.chinese: 神筆沒有變出金子，它變出了一條蛇。

sentences.english: I pen down the spirit of God cool dragon poems are off.
sentences.chinese: 吾落神筆精神爽，巨龍騰飛詩篇現。

sentences.english: God give me a brush to paint the sky.
sentences.chinese: 賜予我神筆描繪多彩的天空。

sentences.english: But it didn't make gold. It made a snake!
sentences.chinese: 但是神筆沒有變出金子，而變出了一條蛇。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
